snippet: A writer with the pen name Don't Speak, an allusion to the fear of getting into trouble in a one-party state, becomes a top literary official of that state &#8212 and wins the world's biggest literary award. Fiction? No - it just happened.
abstract: A writer with the pen name Don't Speak, an allusion to the fear of getting into trouble in a one-party state, becomes a top literary official of that state &#8212 and wins the world's biggest literary award. Fiction? No - it just happened.

headline.main: The Writer, the State and the Nobel
